alert.note: Alert for Barton; Ellsworth; Lincoln; Russell; Saline (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 01 at 9:42AM CST until January 02 at 11:00AM CST by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 11 AM CST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, snow. Total additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, bitter cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero. * WHERE...Russell, Lincoln, Barton, Ellsworth and Saline Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until midnight tonight. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from midnight tonight to 11 AM CST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow will occur now through about early afternoon today.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
